Hey Peter,

S=
ome suggestions:

1) Remember that the units have a defined volume.  You wi=
ll get better
results if, as you increase resolution, single units end up a=
ctivating
more than one sensor as they would in a real world radar system.
=

2) I would stay away from NERO itself because the graphics and the
physics=
 are cost prohibitive for many units.  I suggest making a 2d
case where all=
 of the players are circles (easy collision detection,
easy distance calcul=
ation) and all of the obstacles are convex shapes
(circles would be even be=
tter).  Then you can fight massive wars with
thousands of units and not wor=
ry about the overhead.

3) Try to use my HyperNEAT implementation (ok, this=
 isn't a real
suggestion, more like a shameless plug) :-P

Jason G.
